dcterms:creator: D. J. Richardson
dcterms:description: C-band transmission systems are utilized for numerical simulations in optical communication, focusing on fiber nonlinearities and their compensation techniques.
dcterms:title: C-band transmission systems

dcterms:creator: N. Taengnoi
et al.
dcterms:description: O-band transmission systems are considered for numerical simulations, particularly in the context of fiber bandwidth expansion and nonlinear effects.
dcterms:title: O-band transmission systems

dcterms:creator: F. Buchali
et al.
dcterms:description: The 16-QAM modulation format is used in simulations to analyze its performance in single-channel and multi-channel transmission scenarios.
dcterms:title: 16-QAM modulation format

dcterms:creator: D. Xiaoxiao
et al.
dcterms:description: PAM-4 transmission is examined for its effectiveness in mitigating nonlinear impairments in optical communication systems.
dcterms:title: PAM-4 transmission

dcterms:creator: G. Li
N. Bai
N. Zhao
C. Xia
dcterms:description: WDM channels are analyzed for their role in enhancing capacity in optical communication systems, particularly in the context of nonlinear effects.
dcterms:title: WDM channels

dcterms:creator: G. Agrawal
dcterms:description: Nonlinear Schrodinger equation (NLSE) simulations are employed to model the propagation of signals in optical fibers, focusing on nonlinear effects.
dcterms:title: Nonlinear Schrodinger equation (NLSE) simulations

dcterms:creator: E. Ip
J. M. Kahn
dcterms:description: Digital Back Propagation (DBP) is used as a reference technique for compensating dispersion and nonlinear impairments in optical communication.
dcterms:title: Digital Back Propagation (DBP)

dcterms:creator: B. Karanov
M. Chagnon
F. Thouin
T. A. Eriksson
H. Bulow
D. Lavery
P. Bayvel
L. Schmalen
dcterms:description: Bi-directional LSTM network (Bi-LSTM) is proposed for the mitigation of transmission impairments in optical communication systems.
dcterms:title: Bi-directional LSTM network (Bi-LSTM)
